definitions.body: Sidôn, Sidwn, ancient Phoenician city, on coast N. of Tyre (in As. Ṣidum( n)u, COT:Gloss; TelAm. Ṣiduna, Ph. [[חדן]], OAram. [[חידן]]; in Egypt. Dï-(d)u-na, WMM:As. u. Eur. 184);—‘ first-born ’ of Canaan Ge 10:15 = 1Ch 1:13; northern limit of Canaanite Ge 10:19, cf. Ge 49:13 defined as [[רַבָּה]] ´[[ח]] Jos 11:8 (so Jos 19:28 infr.); also Ju Jdg 1:31, Jdg 10:6 (´[[אְֶהֵֽי ח]]), Jdg 18:28, 1Ki 17:9; named with Tyre Jos 19:28 (cf. v:Jos 19:29), 2Sa 24:6 (cf. v:2Sa 24:7), Is 23:2, Is 23:4 and ´[[בְּתוּלַת בַּת־ח]] v:Is 23:12 (cf. v:Is 23:5 etc.), Je 25:22, Je 27:3, Je 47:4, Ez Eze 27:8, Eze 28:21, Eze 28:22 (cf. v:Eze 28:2; v:Eze 28:12), Zec 9:2, Joe 4:4.—Vid. Pietsch:Phöniz. 54 ff. Prutz:Aus Phönicien (1876), 98 ff. Rob:BR ii.478 ff. de Luynes:Voyage à la mer Morte i 18 ff., and Pl. vi-xi. Bd Pal 3 (1898), 313 ff.
